result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Francis Forrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant has 60 days from January 11 2023 to set up payment plan

records.addlTxt: 8:40 AM Defendant Jeffrey Francis Forrett in court, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Jeffrey Francis Forrett.  Attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders $300 fine plus costs due December 16 2022. Defendant has 60 days from January 11 2023 to set up payment plan

Activity:  Initial appearance

03:31 PM Defendant Jeffrey Francis Forrett in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $150 Signature bond with conditions:  No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.T., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with Hedberg Public Library.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Attorney enters not guilty plea and matter to be set.
